snippet: In China, where pale skin is a sign of status and solar protection something of an obsession, stretchy ski masks are catching on as beachwear.
abstract: Many middle-class Chinese women have begun wearing stretchy ski masks at the beach, reflecting a growing obsession with solar protection that has spawned a booming industry; trend is rooted in the quest for pale skin, a traditional sign of social status that is at odds with the fast-growing interest in beachgoing and other outdoor activities.
lead_paragraph: In China, where pale skin is a sign of status and solar protection something of an obsession, stretchy ski masks are catching on as beachwear.

headline.seo: In China, Sun Protection Can Include a Mask
headline.main: Beach Essentials in China: Flip-Flops, a Towel and a Ski Mask
headline.print_headline: Beach Essentials in China: Flip-Flops, a Towel and a Ski Mask
